tldr: Q1 2025 beat guidance with 4% organic sales growth, flat segment margin at 23%, and adjusted EPS of $2.51. Management maintained full-year organic sales guidance at 2% to 5% while raising EPS outlook to $10.20 to $10.50 amid tariff uncertainty, and highlighted separation planning, the Sundyne deal, and significant buybacks.
bullets: Organic sales rose 4% with adjusted EPS up 7% to $2.51; orders were $10.6B and backlog hit a record $36.1B.
Aerospace grew 9% organically (commercial aftermarket +15%) and building automation grew 8%, while industrial automation and ESS declined 2% each.
Full-year guide: organic sales growth 2% to 5% (1% to 4% ex-Bombardier), sales $39.6B-$40.5B, EPS $10.20-$10.50; Q2 EPS $2.60-$2.70 on $9.8B-$10.1B sales.
themes: Building automation backlog supporting field deployments
Industrial automation softness delaying connected-worker rollouts
Portfolio shift toward software and automation

segments.title: Aerospace Technologies
points: Organic sales rose 9% with commercial aftermarket up 15% and defense and space delivering another double-digit quarter.
Segment margin declined to 26.3% on mix and CASE integration headwinds, partially offset by productivity.

segments.title: Industrial Automation
points: Organic sales declined 2% with PPE weakness and softer Europe/China, while warehouse and workflow solutions returned to growth (+5%).
Segment margin fell 130 bps to 17.8% on volume deleverage and receivables write-downs.

segments.title: Building Automation
points: Organic sales grew 8% with double-digit growth in building solutions and strength in fire and security products.
Segment margin expanded 150 bps on volume leverage, productivity, and access solutions accretion.

segments.title: Energy and Sustainability Solutions
points: Organic sales declined 2%; EOP grew 2% while advanced materials fell 4% on tough flooring comps.
Segment margin expanded 230 bps on LNG acquisition benefits and productivity.

guidance.label: Q2 segment margin
guidance.note: down 20 bps to up 20 bps YoY

notes.title: Tariffs and mitigation
points: Guide assumes current tariffs net of mitigation actions and a demand contingency of roughly 1% on organic sales.
Local-for-local footprint and operating system actions are expected to offset tariff impacts.

notes.title: Portfolio actions and capital return
points: Announced Sundyne acquisition; PPE exit expected in early May.
Repurchased $3B of stock year to date and reaffirmed opportunistic buybacks.

themes.title: Tariffs and demand assumptions
points: Management said tariff impacts are embedded in guidance with mitigation actions underway.
Demand uncertainty is concentrated in short-cycle IA and some energy projects.

themes.title: Aerospace mix and margin
points: OE revenue softness was attributed to mix and revenue recognition timing, not volume.
Aero margins are expected to remain around the Q1 run rate for 2025.

top_questions.question: How much demand destruction is embedded in the 2025 guide?
top_questions.summary: Management cited about a 1% organic sales impact with roughly $0.18 EPS headwind versus the February outlook.

top_questions.question: Why did aero OE revenue lag while volumes improved?
top_questions.summary: Mix of cost-over-sale products and revenue timing drove the shortfall; volumes were up and management expects improvement later in the year.

top_questions.question: What is the timing for the planned separations?
top_questions.summary: Advanced materials is targeted for late 2025/early 2026, with aerospace timing to be refined as regulatory steps progress.

implications: Local-for-local manufacturing reduces tariff exposure versus more globally exposed peers.
Portfolio moves (Sundyne and PPE exit) continue to tilt Honeywell toward higher-margin, long-cycle end markets.
competitive_notes: Pricing actions and productivity offsets suggest limited near-term share pressure despite tariff volatility.
forecast_hooks: Monitor aero OE revenue recoupling with build rates and CASE integration cost timing.
Track IA margin improvement as PPE exits and tariff mitigation actions ramp.

action_items: Validate IA demand trends in China and Europe with channel checks.
Confirm building automation backlog conversion pace in North America and the Middle East.
open_questions: How quickly will Sundyne close and contribute to 2025 results?
Will tariff mitigation fully offset the $0.18 EPS headwind assumed in guidance?
watch_next_quarter: Q2 margin performance versus the 22.8% to 23.2% guide range.
Updates on separation timeline and stranded cost planning.
